title: Understanding Table Columns
text: When working with tables in Excel, adding new columns is a straightforward process. Think about how Excel recognizes the boundaries of a table.

title: Adjacent Columns
text: Consider what happens when you add data or headings next to an existing table. How does Excel respond to this action?

hintAnswer: add new column headings in a column adjacent to the current headings, and Excel automatically adds the adjacent column to the table's range
title: Adding New Column Headings
text: To add a new column to an existing table, you should add new column headings in a column adjacent to the current headings. Excel will automatically include this new column in the table's range.
choices: add new column headings in a column adjacent to the current headings, and Excel automatically adds the adjacent column to the table's range
change the column width, and Excel automatically adds a new column once the width is twice that of a standard column
add a new column of data, and Excel will make that a part of the table
